data.title: [MG Framework] Implement modifier keys API
data.body: This adds an API that exposes CapsLock / NumLock states to the end user (#4729). I didn't add scroll lock because SDL doesn't expose it and looking into how to add it seemed pointless... when was the last time someone even used it?

data.title: MonoGame is not AppDomain-friendly
data.body: Attempting to pass MonoGame types through a MarshalByRefObject into another AppDomain crashes, since no MonoGame types are marked as Serializable. I don't know if I'm just being an idiot and don't know how AppDomains work, but I can't find a way around this. I don't even know if this is a concern for the project, but just letting you know.

data.title: [Eto Forms] Pipeline Tool Main Window
data.body:
NEEDS: #79

There are still stuff to do around here, but most of them are per platform, so I think it will be easier to just merge this and get some help by other members because this is huge change and I could really use some help on it.

Notes:
- No drag & drop, will be implemented in a future PR
  - move action should be rewritten before this is done
- perplatform stuff is located in 3 files, and those are:
  - Style.Platform - some basic styling for controls
  - Global.Platform - some functions that are per platform, like OpenWith dialog and loading native Icons for files and folders
  - ProjectControl.platform - ProjectControl uses treeview which is not multiselectable, the only point of this file is to make it able to select multiple items
- Mac only has a shell implemented for it's platfom stuff instead of using a copy of gtk stuff, this is because we can switch to Xamarin.Mac, @dellis1972 If you have time please try and compile Pipeline Tool with Eto.XamMac instead of Eto.Gtk2, look at ProjectControl.gtk.cs to see how to load stuff into property grid
- ~~some perplatform stuff is missing, this will be added in a future PR, I skipped adding it because of above, that is it can be done for Mac by someone else while I am working on Windows/Linux sides~~
- Full Eto.Forms propertygrid custom drawn :D
  - text editing and selection editing is launching a dialog with a textbox/combobox, I would like to replace this with a control inside the propertygrid itself
  - ~~there is no way to set separator position~~
- ProjectControl.win.cs is a dirty copy of the MultiselectTreeview control
- moved as much stuff as I could from the View to the Controller

No screenshoots :(, download and try the tool from the installer, do tell me what you think about the property grid.

data.title: Windows target (SharpDX): Immediate crash when mouse cursor not on primary monitor
data.body:
The MonoGame executable targeting Windows DirectX (not DesktopGL) will crash immediately when the mouse cursor is not on the primary screen.

My setup is as follows:
A regular gaming PC with a (primary) monitor, and a TV as secondary monitor.
I configured Steam BigPicture mode to use my TV for playing games - for this to work Steam will switch (temporarily) monitors in Windows, so that the TV is the primary desktop while being in BigPicture mode.
I added a non-Steam shortcut to my Steam library to the MonoGame executable.

When starting my (fullscreen) game from Steam BigPicture mode with the gamepad, one of two things will happen:
- If the mouse cursor is on the screen with Steam running (i.e. my TV), the application will launch as expected.
- If the mouse cursor has been shoved to my (now secondary) PC monitor (to get out of the way when playing games), the application will immediately crash. During constructing the crash report, it seems that MonoGame tried to create the game window at the wrong monitor - i.e. not the one running Steam, but the one with the mouse cursor.

data.title: Update adding_ttf_fonts.md
data.body:
Corrected some grammar and added consistency to the way the file is read.

I am new to github and I do not know if I am doing this correctly. Please let me know if I am not.

data.title: [DesktopGL] Fullscreen always set to 800x600
data.body:
Hello,

When entering fullscreen (using `graphics.HardwareModeSwitch = true;`), `SDLGameWindow` always resets the `Viewport` and backbuffer size to 800x600.

This is due to SDL triggering a `Sdl.Window.Event.Id.Resized` (which is correct) but with `ev.Window.Data1` & `ev.Window.Data2` always returning 800 & 600.

As far as I have tested, this happens on Windows and OS X.

Everything is fine on windowed or `graphics.HardwareModeSwitch = false;` fullscreen modes (the event values are the intended ones).

@cra0zy any thoughts? I don't know if this is the normal `Sdl.Window.State.Fullscreen` behavior.

data.title: If Visual Studio has not set registry keys, Templates still greyed out
data.body:
The missing template options are still greyed out in the above case. I'm running Windows 10 with VS 2015, and for some reason my registry keys were never added. Since the Windows installer relies on these keys to find the template directory, and doesn't have a default, the templates are greyed out. 

I am going to hack around this myself, but this should be fixed.

data.title: Pipeline Tool: exception on new/open/import project

milestone.title: 3.6 Release
milestone.description: More unit tests, running unit tests on Mac and Linux, SDL2 replacing OpenTK.

data.body:
Using dev snapshot of the pipeline tool, since almost last week, I got this exception when using open (also new or import):

System.NullReferenceException: La référence d'objet n'est pas définie à une instance d'un objet.
à Eto.WinForms.Forms.WindowsFileDialog2.<>c.<SetFilters>b__9_0(FileDialogFilter f)
à System.Linq.Enumerable.WhereSelectEnumerableIterator2.MoveNext()
à System.String.Join(String separator, IEnumerable1 values)
à Eto.WinForms.Forms.WindowsFileDialog2.SetFilters()
à Eto.WinForms.Forms.WindowsFileDialog`2.ShowDialog(Window parent)
à MonoGame.Tools.Pipeline.MainView.AskOpenProject(String& projectFilePath) dans M:\c#\MonoGame\MonoGame\MonoGame-develop\MonoGame\Tools\Pipeline\Eto\MainWindow.cs:ligne 67
à MonoGame.Tools.Pipeline.PipelineController.OpenProject() dans M:\c#\MonoGame\MonoGame\MonoGame-develop\MonoGame\Tools\Pipeline\Common\PipelineController.cs:ligne 221
à MonoGame.Tools.Pipeline.MainView.OnOpenProjectClick(Object sender, EventArgs e) dans M:\c#\MonoGame\MonoGame\MonoGame-develop\MonoGame\Tools\Pipeline\Windows\MainView.cs:ligne 509
à System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.RaiseEvent(Object key, EventArgs e)
à System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton.OnClick(EventArgs e)
à System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.HandleClick(EventArgs e)
à System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.HandleMouseUp(MouseEventArgs e)
à System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.OnMouseUp(MouseEventArgs mea)
à System.Windows.Forms.Control.WmMouseUp(Message& m, MouseButtons button, Int32 clicks)
à System.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc(Message& m)
à System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.WndProc(Message& m)
à System.Windows.Forms.NativeWindow.Callback(IntPtr hWnd, Int32 msg, IntPtr wparam, IntPtr lparam)

Pipeline tool from official MG 3.5.1 build works (fortunately for me).
Projects are build using protobuild for WinDx platform on win7 64b.

Using VS 2015 to debug, I got:
Exception occured in AskOpenProject (MainWindow.cs) method on line:
var result = dialog.ShowDialog(null) == Eto.Forms.DialogResult.Ok;

[Comment from Alkher on the forum](http://community.monogame.net/t/pipeline-tool-dev-open-a-project-exception/7499/2?u=infiniteproductions):

>  have looked into the code.A call to Init() in MainWindow.cs is missing, so dialog.CurrentFilter = _mgcbFileFilter; filters with a null value... and ShowDialogFails

data.title: Eto.Forms and Pipeline.Windows
data.body: In the MG Windows solution there is Pipeline.Windows, a project that seems to use Eto.Forms. Yet, I don't see a packages config to restore the Eto.Forms NuGet package. Should this be manually installed or is Pipeline.Windows supposed to use NuGet to bind Eto.Forms?

data.title: Allow Bgra4444 textures to be created in DirectX desktop
data.body:
Fixes http://community.monogame.net/t/reading-c-ushort-in-hlsl-float-is-wrong-in-monogame-64-bit-compilation/7443
- DirectX 11.2 re-added Bgra4444 texture format after it was removed in DirectX 10 (Bgra5551 and Bgr565 were re-added in DirectX 11.1). SharpDX for Windows does not appear to have the enum value for it.  Added the special case for this so it didn't create a Color format texture by default.

Other issues found during the investigation of the above fix.
- Found a resource leak when using Texture2D.FromStream() in DirectX.  The texture created in PlatformConstruct() was overwritten by the texture created in PlatformFromStream().  Texture2D instances constructed normally already had the texture created in the call to PlatformSetData() if required.
- Removed a redundant creation of DataBox in PlatformSetData(). UpdateSubresource has an override to take the separate parameters that was called internally by the DataBox override anyway.
- Texture2D.CreateTex2DFromBitmap() should not need to be public since it is only used internally.

data.title: Make SpriteEffect public
data.body: This makes SpriteEffect public like the other built-in effects as discussed in #4766.

data.title: Mouse.SetPosition() not working on Android
data.body: trying to reset the internal mouse position. `Mouse.SetPosition()` is working fine on iOS but unfortunately not on Android.

data.title: Remove unused POINT struct.
data.body: All references to this struct were removed in [this commit](https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/commit/d1d3133e2c10104469a4e84227d5718a42c14f8d).

data.title: Import Collada crashes with NaN error
data.body:
Many collada exporters will leave NaNs in the collada file it seems. Version 3.1.1 of assimp has a bug that causes it to crash when importing these dae files. This bug is reported to be fixed in the latest release (v3.2). Any chance of the dlls in MonoGame being updated to this version soon?

Links to Assimp bug reports on this issue:
https://github.com/assimp/assimp/issues/337
https://github.com/assimp/assimp/issues/345

Assimp commit that should have fixed this:
https://github.com/assimp/assimp/pull/338

Thanks :)

data.title: Memory leak on windows phone 8.1 when using SoundEffectInstance
ModelProcessor GenerateTangetFrames on mixed models
data.body:
ModelProcessor ProcessMesh() MeshHelper.CalculateTangentFrames() will throw an exception if GenerateTangetFrames is true and the mesh has no TextureCooridnates channel.
Check if the TextureCoordinates channel exsist before trying to generate tanget frames.

data.title: Make SpriteEffect public
data.body: I'm doing some stuff for which I need to render sprites with custom vertices. Right now I'm using BasicEffect, but it'd be nice if I could use SpriteEffect since it has everything I need. Is there any good reason for it not being public other than that's the way it is in XNA?

data.title: Revert "Prevent finalizer exception on systems without libgdiplus"
data.body:
This reverts #4534 to make DesktopGL compatible with Monokickstart again. It is temporary and a real fix to this situation will be provided by #4755 (i.e. removing OpenTK / System.Drawing dependencies).

Fixes #4692

data.title: Content Pipeline - Unhandled MS .NET Framework exception
data.body:
"An unhandled Microsoft .NET exception occurred in MGCB.exe [3376]"

What I see is that nothing suspicious is displayed in the build logs... My OS is Windows 10 although I'm not developing on UAP but on Windows DirectX project. Could it also be that my .NET framework installation is buggy? I can "Repair" it using the installer but I don't know which version should that be... Maybe the default project version (4.5)??

data.title: Red/Blue swap implemented in DDS loader
data.body:
The test for a RB swap was incorrect for 32-bit colour textures.
Implemented the RB swap for when it was needed.
Added unit test for a full colour cubemap DDS that needs a RB swap.

data.title: Android N Multi-Window Mode

milestone.title: 4.0 Release
milestone.description: Major new API to support the new graphics libraries like Metal, Vulkan, and DirectX 12.

data.body:
Need to have support ready for the release of Android N (due end 2016) with new Multi-Window Mode.

http://developer.android.com/preview/features/multi-window.html

Resizable docked views, similar to Windows 8.1 resizable docked window.
Picture-in-picture mode is disabled for apps by default, and should stay disabled for MonoGame apps.

PixelShader Custom Structure is not working.
